name: Caroline Redman Lusher
description:
'''Caroline Redman Lusher''' (née '''Caroline Anne Lusher'''; born 17 April 1974) is an English singer and musician, best known for being the founder and director of [[Rock Choir]], the world's largest amateur contemporary choir. 

She is considered to be "responsible for the contemporary choir movement in the UK". She has also had a successful career as a solo artist, performing on various single releases, albums [[Rock Choir]] Vol.1 and [[Rock Choir]] Deluxe released by [[Decca Records|Decca]],  the ''Together'' album by vocal group [[Blake (band)|Blake]] and several albums by [[The Soldiers]], including ''Coming Home'', which reached double platinum status.

Caroline Redman Lusher has gained four gold and platinum certified sales awards from the [[British Phonographic Industry]]. She has been awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Arts for her contribution to music and the arts from [[University of Salford|Salford University]] in 2024 and an Honorary Doctorate of Letters for her contribution to music and community from the [[London College of Music]] in 2017.

On 17 October 2012 Caroline Redman Lusher received the prestigious Gold Badge Award for "special contribution to Britain's music industry", from the [[British Academy of Songwriters, Composers and Authors]] (BASCA) in association with the [[Performing Right Society]] (PRS).

Caroline Redman Lusher was presented with the Freedom of London in 2017 for her lifetime achievement with [[Rock Choir]].

In 2024, Caroline Redman Lusher became a published author with the release of her autobiography, ''SING – The Story of Rock Choir'', which details her career, personal journey, and the creation of [[Rock Choir]].
